seo.title: Best Google Analytics Alternative 2026 - Open Source & Free
seo.description: Looking for a Google Analytics alternative? OpenPanel offers cookie-free, privacy-first analytics with EU-only hosting. No data sent to Google. Open source and free to self-host.

hero.heading: Best Google Analytics Alternative
hero.subheading: OpenPanel is an open-source, privacy-first alternative to Google Analytics. Get both web analytics and product analytics in one tool, without cookies, consent banners, or sending your data to Google.

competitor.name: Google Analytics
competitor.short_description: Free web analytics platform from Google that tracks website traffic, user behavior, and conversions with deep integration into the Google ecosystem.

overview.title: Why consider OpenPanel over Google Analytics?
paragraphs: Google Analytics has been the default analytics tool for over a decade, powering millions of websites with detailed traffic and conversion data. However, the shift to GA4 has left many teams frustrated with its steep learning curve, complex event model, and reduced data retention. Add to that growing privacy concerns around sending visitor data to Google's US servers, and it's no surprise that more teams are looking for a Google Analytics alternative.

OpenPanel is a privacy-first, open-source analytics platform that combines web analytics and product analytics in a single tool. Unlike Google Analytics, OpenPanel tracks visitors without cookies, which means no consent banners and full GDPR compliance out of the box. Your data stays on EU servers, or you can self-host on your own infrastructure for complete control.

Where Google Analytics excels in its deep integration with the Google Ads ecosystem, OpenPanel focuses on giving you clean, actionable insights without the complexity. You get real-time dashboards, funnels, retention analysis, cohorts, and user profiles — features that typically require GA4 360 or a separate product analytics tool. And at just 2.3 KB, the OpenPanel SDK is over 10x lighter than Google's gtag script, which means faster page loads and better Core Web Vitals.
If your team doesn't rely heavily on Google Ads attribution, OpenPanel gives you everything you need at a fraction of the cost and complexity — with the added benefit of owning your data completely.

summary_comparison.title: OpenPanel vs Google Analytics: Which is right for you?
summary_comparison.intro: Both platforms help you understand website traffic and user behavior. The key differences are privacy approach, data ownership, and simplicity vs ecosystem integration.
summary_comparison.one_liner: OpenPanel is privacy-focused and independent; Google Analytics is free but sends your data to Google.
best_for_openpanel: Privacy-conscious teams who want analytics without cookies or consent banners
Businesses that need EU-only data storage for GDPR compliance
Developers who want to self-host and own their data completely
Teams looking for both web analytics and product analytics in one tool
best_for_competitor: Teams heavily invested in the Google Ads ecosystem
Organizations needing advanced attribution modeling for marketing
Large enterprises with dedicated analytics teams and complex reporting needs
Users who need the free tier and can accept the privacy tradeoffs

highlights.title: Key differences at a glance
highlights.intro: Here's how OpenPanel and Google Analytics compare on the factors that matter most.

feature_comparison.title: Feature comparison
feature_comparison.intro: OpenPanel combines web analytics with product analytics. Google Analytics focuses on marketing and traffic analysis with deep Google integration.

features.name: A/B testing
features.notes: Google Optimize was shut down in 2023

features.name: Custom dashboards
features.notes: GA4 uses Explorations for custom reports

features.name: EU data residency
features.notes: GA4 processes data on US servers

features.name: Data export
features.notes: GA4 360 needed for full BigQuery export

technical_comparison.title: Technical comparison
technical_comparison.intro: For developers evaluating analytics tools, here's how the SDKs and technical implementations compare.

items.label: SDK size (JS)
items.notes: OpenPanel's SDK is significantly lighter for better page performance

items.label: Supported platforms
items.notes: GA4 mobile tracking requires Firebase SDK

items.label: Database
items.notes: OpenPanel gives you direct SQL access to your data

items.label: Data retention
items.notes: GA4 has strict retention limits on the free tier

pricing.title: Pricing comparison
pricing.intro: Google Analytics is free for most users, but comes with privacy tradeoffs and data limits. OpenPanel offers more control.

openpanel.description: Simple pricing starting at $2.50/month for 5,000 events. 100,000 events costs $20/month. Self-host for free with unlimited events. No limits on users, dashboards, or data retention.

competitor.description: GA4 is free with limits: data sampling at high volumes, 14-month max data retention, limited explorations. GA4 360 (enterprise) starts at $50,000/year for higher limits and support.

migration.title: Migrating from Google Analytics to OpenPanel
migration.intro: Switching from Google Analytics to OpenPanel is straightforward. You can run both in parallel during transition.

steps.title: Install the OpenPanel script
steps.description: Add the lightweight OpenPanel script to your website. It's a single line of code, similar to the GA4 gtag but much smaller.

steps.title: Set up event tracking
steps.description: Map your GA4 custom events to OpenPanel. The track() API is similar and most events translate directly.

steps.title: Configure dashboards
steps.description: Set up your reports and dashboards in OpenPanel. The interface is simpler than GA4's Explorations.

steps.title: Run in parallel
steps.description: Keep both tools running for a week or two to compare data and ensure everything is tracking correctly.

steps.title: Remove Google Analytics
steps.description: Once verified, remove the GA4 script. You can also remove your cookie consent banner if it was only needed for analytics.

sdk_compatibility.notes: OpenPanel uses a simple track() API. GA4 events like gtag('event', 'purchase', {...}) translate to op.track('purchase', {...}).

historical_data.notes: Google Analytics does not provide easy data export. Historical data stays in GA4. Start fresh with OpenPanel for cleaner, privacy-compliant data.

use_cases.title: Where OpenPanel is a better fit than Google Analytics
use_cases.intro: OpenPanel shines for teams that prioritize privacy, simplicity, and data ownership over the Google ecosystem.

items.title: GDPR-compliant websites
items.description: No cookies, no consent banners, EU-only data storage. Meet privacy regulations without compromising on analytics.

items.title: Marketing without Google
items.description: If you don't rely on Google Ads, you don't need Google Analytics. Get cleaner, faster analytics without sending data to Google.

items.title: Self-hosted requirements
items.description: Deploy OpenPanel on your own infrastructure for complete data ownership. Perfect for regulated industries or security-conscious teams.

items.title: Web + product analytics combined
items.description: Get Plausible-style web analytics and product analytics (funnels, retention, cohorts) in one tool instead of multiple subscriptions.

items.title: Faster websites
items.description: OpenPanel's 2.3 KB SDK vs GA4's 30+ KB means better Core Web Vitals, faster page loads, and improved SEO.

faqs.title: Frequently asked questions
faqs.intro: Common questions about switching from Google Analytics to OpenPanel.

items.question: Is Google Analytics free?
items.answer: Yes, GA4 is free but comes with significant tradeoffs: your data goes to Google, cookies require consent banners, data retention is limited to 14 months, and high-traffic sites experience data sampling. GA4 360 (enterprise) costs $50,000+/year.

items.question: Why switch from Google Analytics?
items.answer: Common reasons include: privacy concerns (data sent to Google), GDPR compliance (cookies require consent), complexity (GA4 has a steep learning curve), and data ownership (you can't self-host or fully export your data).

items.question: Do I need a cookie consent banner with OpenPanel?
items.answer: No. OpenPanel is cookie-free by default and doesn't collect personal data, so no consent banner is required for analytics. This improves user experience and conversion rates.

items.question: Is OpenPanel GDPR compliant?
items.answer: Yes. OpenPanel is EU-based (Sweden), uses cookie-free tracking, hashes IP addresses with daily rotating salts, and stores data on EU servers. We also offer DPA agreements on request.

items.question: Can I import my Google Analytics data?
items.answer: Google Analytics doesn't provide easy data export for migration. We recommend running OpenPanel in parallel with GA4 briefly, then starting fresh with OpenPanel for cleaner, privacy-compliant data.

items.question: How does OpenPanel track users without cookies?
items.answer: OpenPanel uses a privacy-friendly approach: IP addresses and user agents are hashed together with a daily rotating salt. This allows accurate visitor counting (within a 24-hour window) without storing any personal data.

items.question: Does OpenPanel integrate with Google Ads?
items.answer: No, OpenPanel doesn't have native Google Ads integration. If you rely heavily on Google Ads conversion tracking and attribution, GA4 remains the better choice for that specific use case.

items.question: How does the SDK size affect my website?
items.answer: OpenPanel's JavaScript SDK is ~2.3 KB gzipped compared to GA4's 30+ KB. This means faster page loads, better Core Web Vitals scores, and potentially improved SEO rankings.
